summary: Implement a shader-based radial gradient background (purple center to black edges) in a Three.js scene without changing toneMappingExposure, preserving a dark/moody model look with bloom.
architectural_notes: Background visuals should be implemented via a dedicated mesh + ShaderMaterial (no CSS/textures) to avoid affecting model lighting; do not change gl.toneMappingExposure (must remain 0.6).
Ensure scene.background is null so the shader background mesh is visible; keep fog enabled and aligned with edge color (black) for floor fade-out.

existing_features.title: In `frontend/src/components/CubeVisualization.tsx`, implement a shader-based radial gradient background using an inverted sphere (skybox) mesh so the scene background is a deep purple/blue glow in the center fading to black at the edges, without using any external CSS or texture assets.

Update the scene initialization in `CubeVisualization.tsx` so the shader background mesh is visible by setting `scene.background = null`, and set fog to black using `scene.fog = new THREE.FogExp2(0x000000, 0.003)` to preserve floor fade-out behavior.
Preserve the existing renderer tone mapping exposure configuration: do not change `gl.toneMappingExposure` from `0.6` in `CubeVisualization.tsx`.
